_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan
Executive Summary
Nother Country Cooperative Company
Toeterville, IA

1. The Facility Policy:

The Facility Policy: The owners, management and employees of Northern Country Cooperative Company are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia by utilization of proper equipment, regular inspections and maintenance, and training of all persons that work with the material. Should an accidental release occur, the facility has oriented the local fire department and the local emergency planning committee so they can plan for response to any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2. Facility Information:

Ammonia is received, stored, and used in the production of non-hazardous liquid fertilizer solutions. The Facility has been receiving ammonia by truck transports. Mobile unit is brought in for the manufacturer of the fertilizer.

3. Hazard Assessment:

The worst case and alternate case release scenario is not listed in the executive summary for security reasons. 

4. The Five Year Accident History:

There have been no accidental releases of ammonia related to the operation of this facility in the past five years. There have been no deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the Facility. To the best of our knowledge, no off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage has occurred due to the operation of this facility.

5. The Emergency Response Program: 

Northern Country Cooperative Company has a written emergency action plan in accordance with OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.38 and provides state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III of EPCRA. Our emergency response action plan has been reviewed with the local fire department and provided to the local emergency planning committee for coordination in the community response planning.

7. Planned Ch

anges to Improve Safety: Safety improvements are an on-going process at Northern Country Coop. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe practices and operations. There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations for implementatin at this time.
